qas.question: What kind of weapons can usually be found on smaller boats and ships?
These weapons can be deadly to aircraft that is low if it is linked to what?

answers.text: a radar-directed fire-control system radar-controlled cannon for point defence

qas.question: What type of ships are particularly well defended?
Carrier battle groups can launch what to intercept incoming threats?

context: Smaller boats and ships typically have <a0_0>machine-guns or fast cannons<a0_0/>, which can often be deadly to low-flying aircraft if linked to <a1_0>a radar-directed fire-control system radar-controlled cannon for point defence<a1_0/>. Some vessels like Aegis cruisers are as much a threat to aircraft as any land-based air defence system. In general, naval vessels should be treated with respect by aircraft, however the reverse is equally true. <a2_0>Carrier battle groups<a2_0/> are especially well defended, as not only do they typically consist of many vessels with heavy air defence armament but they are also able to launch <a3_0>fighter jets<a3_0/> for combat air patrol overhead to intercept incoming airborne threats.
